longTitle.p: COMMISSION REGULATION (EU) 2020/1000of 9 July 2020correcting certain language versions of Regulation (EU) No 1253/2014 implementing Directive 2009/125/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council with regard to ecodesign requirements for ventilation units

citation.p: Having regard to the Treaty on the Functioning of the European Union,

Having regard to Directive 2009/125/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council of 21 October 2009 establishing a framework for the setting of ecodesign requirements for energy-related products
OJ L 285, 31.10.2009, p. 10. , and in particular Article 15(1) thereof,

recital.p:
The Bulgarian, Croatian, Czech, Danish, Dutch, Estonian, Finnish, German, Greek, Hungarian, Italian, Latvian, Lithuanian, Maltese, Polish, Slovak, Slovenian, Spanish and Swedish language versions of Commission Regulation (EU) No 1253/2014
Commission Regulation (EU) No 1253/2014 of 7 July 2014 implementing Directive 2009/125/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council with regard to ecodesign requirements for ventilation units (OJ L 337, 25.11.2014, p. 8). contain errors in point (g) of Article 1(2) as regards the ventilation units which are excluded from its scope. Those errors affect the substance of that provision.

The Maltese language version of Regulation (EU) No 1253/2014 also contains an error in point (h) of Article 1(2) as regards the ventilation units which are excluded from its scope. That error affects the substance of that provision.

The Swedish language version of Regulation (EU) No 1253/2014 contains an additional error in point 1(9) of Annex I, point 1(o) of Annex IV and point 1(o) of Annex V as regards one of the terms defined for the purposes of Annexes II to IX. That error affects the substance of those provisions.

The Bulgarian, Croatian, Czech, Danish, Dutch, Estonian, Finnish, German, Greek, Hungarian, Italian, Latvian, Lithuanian, Maltese, Polish, Slovak, Slovenian, Spanish and Swedish language versions of Regulation (EU) No 1253/2014 should therefore be corrected accordingly. The other language versions are not affected.
The measures provided for in this Regulation are in accordance with the opinion of the Committee established by Article 19(1) of Directive 2009/125/EC,

content.p: This Regulation shall enter into force on the twentieth day following that of its publication in the Official Journal of the European Union.
This Regulation shall be binding in its entirety and directly applicable in all Member States.
